intro: Sida picklesiana, commonly known as the velvetleaf sida, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, soft hairs, giving it a velvety texture. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the summer months. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. Sida picklesiana is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes other plants such as hibiscus and cotton.
